name: Nitigya Kargeti
headline: System Builder — Data-Intensive Backend & Applied ML
profile: Engineer focused on scalable, low-latency data systems, AWS pipelines, and LLM-integrated applications. Quantified impact across research and startups; owner/maintainer of user-facing software.

experience.company: People & Robots Lab (NSF-funded), University of Wisconsin–Madison
highlights: Engineered FastAPI services with WebSockets processing 1,000+ events/session; async MongoDB controllers reduced median query latency by ~30%.
Authored a lightweight Misty II control library (REST/WebSocket, TTS) replacing ROS/Docker stack, cutting deployment overhead.
Designed grounded LLM pipeline with JSON visual-context store and grade-level frameworks, improving factual consistency.
Built multi-agent orchestration with RBAC and role-policy engine; owned backend for 20-family in-home field study; co-authored ACM CHI 2025 paper.
Mentored 3-person undergrad team; established code guidelines, PR reviews, and weekly cadence.
Architected AWS serverless ETL pipeline (Lambda, SQS, S3) with DLQs and backoff; reduced p95 by ~70%, 99.95% success rate.
Engineered one-click migration to Stripe Connected Accounts; migrated 20k+ customer records with zero downtime.
Shipped multi-currency support with forward/backward DB migrations; structured logging improved triage.

experience.company: Centre for Development of Advanced Computing (CDAC), Govt. of India
highlights: Re-engineered EEG P300 Keyspeller pipeline, reducing latency by 30%, improving accuracy by 10%.
Built face-detection & expression-cropping automation tool (OpenCV) for training datasets.
Modernized legacy Python 2.7 code to Python 3.x with async streaming.
Analyzed hyperspectral imagery with Linear Mixture Modeling; achieved 88% accuracy.
Optimized Spectral Angular Mapper workflow cutting analysis time by 10%.
